summary: The document is an agent report dated October 5, 1967, focusing on Peter Karl Simons, a Specialist 4 in the US Army. It details his personal and military background, including his service number, date and place of birth, citizenship, education, employment history, and military service. The report also covers a 'Possible Sensitive Desertion' case, his enlistment under the Buddy Assignment Plan, and specifics about his leave and advance pay.
key_findings: Peter Karl Simons was a Specialist 4 in the US Army with a service number RA 19 841 799.
The report highlights a 'Possible Sensitive Desertion' case involving Simons.
Simons was born in Cottbus, Germany, on May 5, 1943, and entered the US on August 8, 1962.
He had a diverse civilian employment history before joining the Army in April 1965.
The document details Simons' military education, promotions, and assignments, including service in Germany and at various US bases.
Simons was granted leave to Frankfurt, Germany, in August 1967, with instructions to report to the Army attach√© at the American Embassy.
The report mentions Simons drew advance pay of $360 in August 1967, to be repaid at $60 a month for six months.
